Graphic pro-life flyers in mailboxes spark outrage in Thorold
Mother recovering from delivery was shocked to have the disturbing images delivered to her house







Ludvig Drevfjall
 Dec 14, 2020 4:53 PM








Share by Email





Share on Facebook





Share on X





Share on LinkedIn





Print




Share via Text Message





The front of the flyer. Thorold News is not showing the graphic imagery within. Photo: Kate Turpin/Supplied

Several Thorold residents are outraged after graphic pro-life-pamphlets were dropped in their private mailboxes.
Kate Turpin, a mother of three said she received the flyer on Monday morning, after seeing a person around high school age bolting away from her Thorold residence, seemingly after dropping it off.
"I saw the pictures and knew right away what it was. It was disturbing," said Turpin to Thorold News.
"I have a newborn at home and am still recovering from labor and delivery, and two other kids who could have seen this among all the Christmas cards that are going around this time of the year. To see this in my mailbox was pretty awful, heartbreaking."
Turpin stressed she thinks everyone has a right to their own opinion, but that dropping off unsolicited sensitive imagery is wrong."
She posted the front of the flyer in a local Facebook group to warn others and learned that many others had gotten the flyer in the mail in the last few weeks.
Several people said they had seen young people walking door-to-door to drop off the flyer.
It was not immediately clear who distributes the flyers locally, but attributions on the flyer lead to Calgary-based Canadian Centre For Bio-Ethical Reform who previously has been criticized for distributing similar flyers in London, Ontario, earlier this year.
The distribution of flyers in that case led to local calls for action from the federal government against unsolicited graphic images.
Kate Turpin said she hopes other parents in the area are made aware of what might be hiding in their mailboxes.
"I would be glad if this can help someone to be prepared, and throw it away."
